settings.custom_liquid:
The Science
Behind Red Algae

Using cutting-edge scientific technology, we’ve extracted nature’s most powerful antioxidant, and the skincare world’s most coveted ingredient, that’s remained largely inaccessible in its most potent form since its evolution.
The results have been life-changing.

Skin Microbiome

An imbalance in the skin's microbiome will lead to upsetting issues like acne, rosacea, dryness, eczema, and more.
Think about that perfectly soft, smooth skin you see on babies – their microbiome has not been altered by the environment, hormones, or chemicals.
So, when people talk and search for glowing, smooth skin… what they are really searching for is healthy skin.
Skin that has the ideal microbiome balance.

Damaged Skin Microbiome

Healthy Skin Microbiome

settings.heading: Nature’s Best Antioxidant
settings.description:
Astaxanthin is nature’s strongest antioxidant and the bioactive compound in red algae.
Red algae in the deep ocean would have been destroyed by ultraviolet light without a powerful antioxidant. In order to survive these ultraviolet radiations, the algae evolved a bioactive compound called Astaxanthin.
The ability for it to act as an antioxidant means that it protects your cells from environmental stressors such as pollution, temperature changes and skin sensitivity. All of this leads to minimising the occurrence of acne or other inflammatory conditions on your skin.

settings.heading: Anti-Ageing Superstar
settings.description: Astaxanthin, found in red algae, inhibits the formation of reactive oxygen species (ROS) and modulates the expression of oxidative stress-responsive enzymes, making it a perfect anti-ageing ingredient.

settings.heading: Acne Fighter
settings.description: Red algae contain polysaccharides and bioactive compounds that have been shown to inhibit bacterial growth, as well as treat skin inflammatory conditions by inhibiting the effect of pro-inflammatory genes. When it comes to acne, red algae is an effective ingredient for many reasons—it aids in treating pigmentation and redness that comes along with this condition; supports the work of other active ingredients in your skincare regimen; and most importantly keeps your skin hydrated.

settings.heading: Say bye to bad to redness
settings.description:
Red algae contain antioxidants and anti-inflammatory compounds, which would be beneficial to rosacea sufferers.
Excessive ROS production can trigger skin conditions like rosacea. Antioxidants are your best defenses against free radicals— Astaxanthin is six thousand times more effective than Vitamin C at neutralizing them and 550 times better than Vitamin E!
People with Rosacea have higher levels of an inflammatory mediator called cathelicidins, which are part of the skin's defense system. Red Algae contains bioactive compounds that can inhibit the production of pro-inflammatory cytokines and reduce the expression of inflammatory genes.

settings.heading: Brain Power
settings.description: Carotenoids, including astaxanthin, have a positive effect on the brain by reducing the risks for neurodegenerative diseases. Astaxanthin is smaller than other carotenoids and can cross into your blood-brain barrier to add protection against these damaging conditions.This carotenoid may help prevent Alzheimer's disease, as well as other cognitive disorders and slow the onset rate of these diseases.

settings.heading: Healthy Heart Function
settings.description: Astaxanthin can help lower your cholesterol by reducing LDL or "bad" cholesterol and increasing HDL or "good" cholesterol, while lowering blood pressure.

settings.heading: Helps With Exercise- Related Fatigue
settings.description: Astaxanthin helps to enhance the body’s ability to burn fat during and after exercising, which improves exercise endurance and stamina.

Why suffer side-effects when you don’t have to?

settings.heading: Azaleic acid
settings.description: Azaleic acid causes dryness, peeling and itching of the skin.

settings.custom_liquid:
The Science
Behind Red Algae

Red algae—both in our Recovery and Repair gel, which is applied topically,
as well as consumed in the form of a collagen drink—has many benefits.

Ingesting red algae offers more benefits than applying it topically:
Super Immune System Strength

The antioxidant astaxanthin, found in red algae can help activate white blood cells (T-cells) and natural killer (NK) cells—important parts of your immune system's health!
